title: Nate Silver - Wikipedia
snippet: Nathaniel Read Silver (born January 13, 1978) is an American statistician, political analyst, author, sports gambler, and poker player who analyzes baseball, basketball, football, and elections. He is the founder of FiveThirtyEight and held the position of editor-in-chief there, along with ...

title: Nate Silver – FiveThirtyEight
snippet: Nate Silver founded and was the editor in chief of FiveThirtyEight.

title: Nate Silver of FiveThirtyEight’s advice to founders | Fortune
snippet: He’s also a founder who sold his media business, only to leave a decade later as more than half of his team got the boot. Now that he’s regrouping for the next challenge, he has some advice to share to founders considering whether to sell their own startups. FiveThirtyEight.com, named after the number of votes in the Electoral College, was founded in 2008 by Silver as a data-driven news site that covered politics, economics, and sports—or, in other words, a blog.

title: Contributors | FiveThirtyEight
snippet: Emily Scherer was FiveThirtyEight’s senior designer. Nate Silver founded and was the editor in chief of FiveThirtyEight.

title: FiveThirtyEight - Wikipedia
snippet: While under the ownership of ESPN in 2016, FiveThirtyEight won the Data Journalism Website of the Year award from the Global Editors Network. Founder Nate Silver left in 2023, taking the rights to his forecasting model with him to his website ...
